title: Greek funerary inscription of Kallistratos
support: The stone is one of three described as 'petra nigra' by Gualtherus (1624: 50), but neither state of conservation nor dimensions are recorded.

layout.p: The text is presented as split over three lines

handNote.lettering: Plain transcription in standard capitals makes it impossible to assess the letter-forms.

date._: A date in the period 4th — 1st century BCE seems most likely, but it is impossible to be certain in the absence of further information

provenanceFound._: Described by Gualtherus (1624) as coming from the ruins popularly identified with the shrine of the god Hadranus (not identified). All later editions derive from Gualtherus.

facsimile.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana
